content.description: Test cases usage. (2016 Fall, Final, Question 9)

p.line: You plan to test an algorithm with a set of very extensive test cases. Which is true?
Only if it fails all test cases is the program incorrect.
Only if it fails more than half is the program incorrect.
If it passes more than half, the program is considered correct.
If it passes all of them, the program is considered correct.

content.hint: Failing once means fail. Passing all test cases doesn't means working correctly for all possible inputs.
